skill.name: pydicom
skill.description: Python library for working with DICOM (Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine) files. Use this skill when reading, writing, or modifying medical imaging data in DICOM format, extracting pixel data from medical images (CT, MRI, X-ray, ultrasound), anonymizing DICOM files, working with DICOM metadata and tags, converting DICOM images to other formats, handling compressed DICOM data, or processing medical imaging datasets. Applies to tasks involving medical image analysis, PACS systems, radiology workflows, and healthcare imaging applications.

This skill is legitimate medical imaging documentation containing only safe Python utilities for processing DICOM files.

content.value_statement: Working with medical imaging data requires specialized handling for DICOM files, the standard format used in healthcare. This skill provides guidance on reading, converting, anonymizing, and extracting data from CT, MRI, X-ray, and ultrasound images.
actual_capabilities: Read and parse DICOM files from any medical imaging modality
Extract and display patient and study metadata
Convert DICOM images to PNG, JPEG, TIFF, or BMP formats
Anonymize patient health information (PHI) in DICOM files
Handle compressed DICOM data including JPEG and JPEG 2000
Access and manipulate pixel data for medical image analysis
limitations: Does not perform diagnostic image analysis or automated detection
Requires pydicom and optional dependencies for compression handling
Does not connect to PACS systems or hospital networks
Does not validate clinical correctness of medical data

best_practices: Always check for attribute existence with hasattr() or getattr() before accessing DICOM tags
Apply proper VOI LUT windowing when displaying CT or MRI images for correct contrast
Verify anonymization thoroughly before sharing any medical imaging data
anti_patterns: Assuming all DICOM files have the same tags present - always handle missing attributes
Displaying pixel data without applying windowing or rescale parameters
Sharing DICOM files without first anonymizing all patient identifiers

faq.question: What DICOM modalities are supported?
faq.answer: All modalities including CT, MRI, X-ray, ultrasound, PET, mammography, and nuclear medicine images.

faq.question: What compression formats can pydicom handle?
faq.answer: JPEG baseline, JPEG lossless, JPEG 2000, RLE, and MPEG. Some require additional packages like pylibjpeg.

faq.question: Can I use this with Claude Code or other AI assistants?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for medical imaging tasks.

faq.question: Is patient data safe when using these scripts?
faq.answer: Scripts process data locally. Anonymization script removes PHI but always verify output before sharing.

faq.question: Why am I seeing decode errors for pixel data?
faq.answer: Install additional handlers with: pip install pylibjpeg pylibjpeg-libjpeg python-gdcm for compression support.

faq.question: How does this compare to other DICOM tools?
faq.answer: Pydicom is a pure Python library ideal for scripting. For GUIs, consider ImageJ or Horos. For web apps, use dicom-parser.
